ImageData.LabelName: Stage III Nonmelanoma Skin Cancer of the Head and Neck (2)

OriginalSource.Creator: Terese Winslow
OriginalSource.Comment: Diversity updates: changed figure to an older male; updated skin tone to FP type I
Moved the box with the large, cancerous lymph node up to a lymph node near the neck; added "of the Head and Neck" to the title
Made the cancer in the lymph node a little bigger and darker
Changed text in top inset box to "Tumor is 4 cm or smaller"
Removed the bones that show through on the right side of the face
Revised image per AJCC 8th edition updates
In upper right inset, replaced "plus" with "and may have".
Made the single large lymph node under the arm larger and put a box around it; flipped the grape so the stem is on top.

Replaced “factor” with “feature”; added hyphen to “high-risk”; deleted labels Side of skull, Eye socket, and Jaw; added a large lymph node where the left inset lines join the body; changed wording in left inset to say “3 cm or smaller”; added stem to grape.

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Stage III nonmelanoma skin cancer of the head and neck (2); drawing shows a primary tumor on the face and cancer in one lymph node on the same side of the body as the tumor. The top inset shows that the tumor is 4 centimeters or smaller and that 4 centimeters is about the size of a walnut. The bottom inset shows that the lymph node with cancer is 3 centimeters or smaller and that 3 centimeters is about the size of a grape.

Stage III nonmelanoma skin cancer of the head and neck (2); drawing shows a primary tumor on the face and cancer in one lymph node on the same side of the body as the tumor. The top inset shows that the tumor is 4 centimeters or smaller and that 4 centimeters is about the size of a walnut. The bottom inset shows that the lymph node with cancer is 3 centimeters or smaller and that 3 centimeters is about the size of a grape.

Captions.MediaCaption: Stage III nonmelanoma skin cancer of the head and neck (2). The tumor is 4 centimeters or smaller. Cancer has spread to one lymph node on the same side of the body as the tumor and the node is 3 centimeters or smaller.

Stage III nonmelanoma skin cancer of the head and neck (2). The tumor is 4 centimeters or smaller. Cancer has spread to one lymph node on the same side of the body as the tumor and the node is 3 centimeters or smaller.

ProposedUse.Glossary: stage III nonmelanoma skin cancer on the head and neck (not on the eyelid)
